blog.name: irisbleufic
blog.title: (lives between pages)
blog.description: Holistic Writer / INTJ / Chaotic Good / Slytherin / Jewish / QIA-spec in LGBTQIA+ / autistic rabblerouser / still in my 30s / they-pronouns. Emma Goldman stan. Survivor of traumas I only discuss when relevant. Contains black tea, insomnia, poetry, & fic—but mostly just fic. If you're looking for CoT 'Verse and the rest of my Good Omens fic, you can find it here. As of 2013, all of my old LJ-era fanfiction has been uploaded to AO3. I'm the nutter behind @ask-agnes-nutter, so feel free to send asks. I moderate for the largest, most active GO Discord server, The Ritz; if you would like an invite, please DM me. You can pester me; I strongly encourage anons, because I know not everyone finds sending asks easy. If you want to know where to find my published work, email me on irisbleufic@gmail.com or send a DM. If you make art based on my writing, podfic my stories, or do anything you want me to see, tag it #irisbleufic. I won’t tell folks they shouldn't follow, but there's complex content here. I tag thoroughly. You can ko-fi me if you wish.

summary: getting caught up on your blog and holy fucking shirtballs are you legit saying the last EVER installment of cot is going up on...
question: getting caught up on your blog and holy fucking shirtballs are you legit saying the last EVER installment of cot is going up on valentine’s day????
answer:
Yep, that’s exactly what I’m saying. CoT #75 has been through five editorial passes by my own hand since I finished it last week, and it’s currently with a beta. In truth, I think it’s about as ready to see light of AO3 as it will ever be, but I set a date at readers’ behest, and I will honor it.  This series has been my love letter to the novel and to the fandom.

(Nice use of Good Place cursing, anon. It didn’t go unnoticed!)

tags: how tag fic recs i literally never do this
summary: hello!! really enjoy your blog! do you happen to have any crowley/aziraphale or just any good omens fic recs?? thanks!
question: hello!! really enjoy your blog! do you happen to have any crowley/aziraphale or just any good omens fic recs?? thanks!
answer:
Hey thanks! 

Uhhhhh ok I have never written a full on list of fic recs ever so basically I’m gonna yell at you to read the one I yell at everyone in 2019 fandom to read because I imprinted on it like a tiny little duckling when I was 14, and the rest are ones I’ve just enjoyed recently. @azfellandco has a great fic recs tag both of stuff people have written recently, and like actual people’s lists of fic recs including a lot of the fandom staples, so please go check that out too!

So alright here we go:

Bright Within his Splendour by daegaer. Read the whole Captain Crowley series, in fact, but this one is a good standalone. This was like my first exposure to World War I and hit me in a big way when I was a little baby, and on rereads as an adult I’ve only grown to love it more. All time fave.

As for stuff I’ve read and enjoyed relatively recently off the top of my head:

men have gone to heaven for smaller things than that by mercuryhatter. It’s a short, angsty little drabble, but I’m still thinking about it. Big sad Queer Aziraphale stuff and I love it.

Makes a Life Worth Living by DwarvenBeardSpores. Crowley and Aziraphale posing as the nanny and the gardener during the Dowling years. I have a soft spot for kidfic and this super hits it.

names for sides by NeverNooitNiet. I read it literally YESTERDAY but it’s one of my favorite Aziraphale Falling/Crowley becoming an angel again fics I’ve ever read. It’s simple, in-character, and so perfectly them. I just got distracted reading it again.

hard feelings/loveless by witching. About that “I can’t explain [love], especially not to you,” bit. Been thinking about it a lot.

Yours, Truly by mirawonderfulstar because I’m big gay over sappy letters. 

And of course you can check out my fics on ao3 or go through my fic tag since I’m awful at archiving my drabbles and shit. Basically I’m either writing askbox drabbles or overly ambitious multichapters based on jokes I decided to take and run with to see if I could make them any good. Happy reading!

tags: please let me enjoy my angels demons and apocalypse people without Doing This Again
i suffered through NOT REAL QUEERBAITING being ‘called out’ all fhe time in supernatural
im so goddamn tired and i WILL unfollow people even if i like you
maybe delete later if people get angry at me
im no longer afraid to start blocking people
Aziraphale: is super gay in every way shape and form but says ‘im not gay’ once and you take it as fact and like a joke from the authors
it’s more like ‘make him obviously gay but make our straight publishers think he isnt’
say it with me: it’s not regressive if it was made before the progress you want happened
like...i trust Neil to do a good job you know? he’s a good writer and a cool dude
and he is Aware of the fandom and its discourse

tags: idk I just thought it was interesting that Queen took the top spot!
also just imagine if the Bentley was stuck playing Walking on Sunshine lol
summary: Top 10 “Feel-Good” Songs
title: Top 10 “Feel-Good” Songs
body:
According to a 2015 study by Dr. Jacob Jolij, the top ten “feel-good” songs for those living in the UK are:

  • Don’t Stop Me Now (Queen)
  • Dancing Queen (ABBA)
  • Good Vibrations (The Beach Boys)
  • Uptown Girl (Billy Joel)
  • Eye of the Tiger (Survivor)
  • I’m a Believer (The Monkees)
  • Girls Just Want to Have Fun (Cyndi Lauper)
  • Livin’ on a Prayer (Bon Jovi)
  • I Will Survive (Gloria Gaynor)
  • Walking on Sunshine (Katrina & the Waves)

reblog.comment:

  • Don’t Stop Me Now (Queen)
  • Dancing Queen (ABBA)
  • Good Vibrations (The Beach Boys)
  • Uptown Girl (Billy Joel)
  • Eye of the Tiger (Survivor)
  • I’m a Believer (The Monkees)
  • Girls Just Want to Have Fun (Cyndi Lauper)
  • Livin’ on a Prayer (Bon Jovi)
  • I Will Survive (Gloria Gaynor)
  • Walking on Sunshine (Katrina & the Waves)

trail.content_raw:
According to a 2015 study by Dr. Jacob Jolij, the top ten “feel-good” songs for those living in the UK are:

  • Don’t Stop Me Now (Queen)
  • Dancing Queen (ABBA)
  • Good Vibrations (The Beach Boys)
  • Uptown Girl (Billy Joel)
  • Eye of the Tiger (Survivor)
  • I’m a Believer (The Monkees)
  • Girls Just Want to Have Fun (Cyndi Lauper)
  • Livin’ on a Prayer (Bon Jovi)
  • I Will Survive (Gloria Gaynor)
  • Walking on Sunshine (Katrina & the Waves)
trail.content:

summary: i think my favorite thing about aziraphale is that, however homophobic the jokes in the book are about him, he’s clearly very...
body:
i think my favorite thing about aziraphale is that, however homophobic the jokes in the book are about him, he’s clearly very happy being who he is. he loves his wilde first editions, he loves having manicured hands, he LITERALLY DECLARES HIMSELF to be not just a southern pansy, THE southern pansy

aziraphale is queer pride incarnate and i’m very glad he’s ours
